items.title: Big Storage Draw Seen Shrinking Winter Buffer as Natural Gas Prices Stay Elevated
items.summary: NGI is forecasting the latest Lower 48 U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report through the week ended Dec. 12 to show a withdrawal of 168 Bcf.

items.title: Warm Forecasts Pressure Natural Gas Futures, Cash Lower at Midday
items.summary: The loss of heating degree days in recent revisions to December weather forecasts kept the outlook too warm to spark a meaningful response from market bulls, and natural gas futures continued to retreat.

items.title: Train 1 Commissioning Accelerates at Golden Pass, Setting Up Early 2026 LNG Production
items.summary: Golden Pass LNG developers have been cleared to begin key testing processes for Train 1 following delivery of a cooldown cargo, pushing the project a critical step closer to first production.

items.title: NextEra Boosts Natural Gas Muscle With Symmetry Deal as Data Center Loads Surge
items.summary: Symmetry Energy Solutions, which provides retail natural gas supply and storage solutions nationwide, is being snapped up by NextEra Energy Resources LLC to complement its gas pipeline buildout to serve large loads, including data centers.

items.title: Late-December Warmth Sidelines Bulls, Pushes Natural Gas Futures Lower
items.summary: January natural gas futures drifted between modest gains and losses early Monday after tumbling more than $1.00/MMBtu last week, as forecasts pointing to one of the warmest late-December periods in 50 years continued to sideline bullish interest.

items.title: LNG Supply Expands Faster Than China’s Demand Growth
items.summary: China’s LNG demand is disappointing in 2025 for a second year in a row, just as new U.S. export projects ramp up and Qatar is nearing start-up of the first new facilities in its huge capacity expansion. The wave of new LNG supply that will come onlin

items.title: ICE To Expand Europe’s Gas Futures Trading Amid Surging U.S. LNG Demand
items.summary: The Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) has revealed plans to extend trading hours for its European gas and power futures to match the 22-hour trading cycles of the United States’ Henry Hub and JKM (Japan Korea Marker) markets. ICE aims to streamline tra

items.title: IEA: Coal Outpaces Gas in OECD Power Mix as "Bridge Fuel" Falters
items.summary: The global energy transition displayed a stark duality in September 2025, as a record-breaking surge in solar power generation clashed with the stubborn persistence of coal consumption across major economies.  New data released by the International E

items.title: Russia Weighs Extending Gasoline Export Ban
items.summary: Russia could extend the ban on gasoline exports by the end of February from the current end-date December 31, 2025, state news agency TASS reported on Monday, quoting sources familiar with the discussions in the government.  Currently, Russia has a b

items.title: The Real Reason Behind U.S. Resuming Iraqi Kurdistan Oil Imports
items.summary: An oil tanker carrying crude from the Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KRI) unloaded its cargo at a U.S. port at the very end of last month – the first since the reopening of the critical Iraq-Turkey Pipeline (ITP) around two months ago. According to indust

items.title: Will the Oil Curse Strike South America’s Wealthiest Country?
items.summary: In a remarkable turnaround, the tiny South American country of Guyana, once one of the continent’s poorest nations, now ranks among the world’s top 10 wealthiest countries by gross domestic product (GDP) per capita. In a mere decade, Guyana went from

items.title: U.S. Wants EU to Exempt Its LNG from Methane Regulation
items.summary: The United States insists that the European Union exempt it from obligations to report data under the EU Methane Regulation until 2035, Reuters reported on Monday, citing a U.S. document circulated to EU governments. The U.S. and its gas industry hav

items.title: Kazakhstan Battles Big Oil in $3.5 Billion Arbitration Case
items.summary: Kazakhstan expects a court ruling on its $3.5-billion lawsuit against international majors by the end of this year, Energy Minister Yerlan Akkenzhenov said on Monday as the country is suing Big Oil in several separate proceedings with total compensat
